meanings.definition: A temporary decline or decrease in value or price.
meanings.sent1: During economic downturns, investors may experience pullbacks in stock prices.
meanings.sent2: The pullbacks in housing prices have made it a good time to buy a new home.
meanings.sent3: The sudden pullback in the cost of bananas left shoppers pleasantly surprised.
meanings.sent4: The pullback in the value of the antique mirror was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The pullbacks in the market can be opportunities for savvy investors.

meanings.definition: A retreat or withdrawal of troops.
meanings.sent1: The general ordered a pullback of the soldiers to regroup.
meanings.sent2: The pullback of the army was strategic in avoiding further casualties.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected pullback of the troops caught the enemy off guard.
meanings.sent4: The pullback of the forces allowed for a tactical advantage.
meanings.sent5: The pullbacks of the troops signaled a change in the battle strategy.

meanings.definition: A reduction in speed or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The coach instructed the team to do pullbacks during training to work on speed.
meanings.sent2: The pullbacks in the race helped the runner conserve energy for the final sprint.
meanings.sent3: The sudden pullback in the car's speed caused everyone to lurch forward.
meanings.sent4: The pullback in the music tempo created a more relaxed atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The pullbacks in the workout routine were challenging but effective.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used to slow or stop a moving object.
meanings.sent1: The emergency pullback on the roller coaster prevented a collision.
meanings.sent2: The pullback on the toy car allowed it to come to a gentle stop.
meanings.sent3: The pullback on the door was broken, causing it to slam shut loudly.
meanings.sent4: The pullback on the curtains made it easy to let in natural light.
meanings.sent5: The pullbacks on the conveyor belt ensured safe operation of the machinery.

meanings.definition: A type of exercise that strengthens the muscles in the upper body.
meanings.sent1: She included pullbacks in her workout routine to tone her arms.
meanings.sent2: The trainer demonstrated proper form for pullbacks to avoid injury.
meanings.sent3: The pullbacks with resistance bands were challenging but effective.
meanings.sent4: He felt the burn in his shoulders after doing pullbacks with weights.
meanings.sent5: The pullbacks helped improve her posture and upper body strength.
